# Government Tender Announcement

## Contract Information

* **Contract Title (English)**: Educational and Library Services for Dorchester Penitentiary Complex
* **Contract Title (French)**: Services éducatifs et de bibliothèque pour le Plein centre de détention de Dorchester
* **Contract Reference Number**: CB-8839
* **Amendment Number**: 7
* **Solicitation Number**: 21208-24-4441674
* **Publication Date**: 7 September 2023
* **Tender Closing Date**: 23 October 2023, 13:00:00
* **Expected Contract Start Date**: 1 January 2024
* **Expected Contract End Date**: 31 December 2024

## Tender Description

The Correctional Service of Canada requires a contractor to provide educational and library services for the Dorchester Penitentiary Complex.

The contractor must provide:

* 7 teachers/instructors to deliver educational programs (35 hours/week, 7 hours/day)
* 2 bilingual teachers/instructors qualified to teach in both official languages
* 1 library technician to deliver library services (30 hours/week, flexible hours)

The contractor must also provide educational services, including:

* Adult Basic Education (ABE) program
* Adapted ABE programs
* Educational programs leading to the Adult High School Diploma
* Coordination of post-secondary pre-requisite courses, correspondence courses, and other programs

## Evaluation Criteria

The selection process will be based on the Lowest Cost-per-Point criteria.

## Important Dates

* Tender Closing Date: 23 October 2023
* Expected Contract Start Date: 1 January 2024
* Expected Contract End Date: 31 December 2024

## Contact Information

* Jolaine Amos, Contracting Authority
* Phone: 506-269-3787
* Email: jolaine.amos@csc-scc.gc.ca

## Additional Information

* Please note that all bidder submissions must be in either English or French.
* After contract award, bidders may request a debriefing on the results of the bid solicitation process. To request a debriefing, contact the Contracting Authority within 15 working days of receipt of the results of the bid solicitation process. The debriefing may be in writing, by telephone, or in person.
